item.title: 13. A Primer in Understanding and Projecting Returns from Stocks and Bonds
item.description: What determines the returns from stocks and bonds? A stock buyer expects a growing stream of dividends. If the company re-invests its profits, the stock buyer expects more rapidly growing dividends in the future, or a lucrative stock buyback. Long-run Equity Return = Initial Dividend Yield + Growth Rate In the short run (e.g. a year) the changes in price/dividend or price/earnings multiples determine returns. In optimistic times, e.g. March 2000, P/E > 30 and P/D > 80.
